Printers’ Ink Publishing Company
205 EAST 42"° STREET, NEW YORK 17, NY.
ROBERT E. KENTON, JR.
ADVERTISING DIRECTOR
September 18, 1952
Mr. Frank Schooley, Treasurer,
National Association of Educational Broadcasters,
University of Illinois,
Urbana, Illinois.
Dear Mr. Schooley:
I have just read your advertisement for
**The Jeffersonian Heritage** in the September 8th
issue of Broadcasting and believe it is a message
that would interest the readers of Printers* Ink.
In our audience of 24>000 people inter¬
ested in advertising are the advertising, manage¬
ment, sales and agency executives who are the ones
who select media and programs. Many of them are
prospects for the series of half hour radio dramas
which you are now presenting.
We have recently published a special re¬
port on National Spot Radio. In the report we listed
many of the ways that radio advertising can be ef¬
fectively used to sell merchandise. These appeals
are of course adaptable to a program like **The
Jeffersonian Heritage**.
A full page in Printers* Ink at present
rates costs $520. A wire from you will reserve a
page in the next available issue.
If you*d like any further information about
Printers* Ink, please let me know.
Cordially,
REK:MF
